alert.note: Alert for Crittenden; Cross; Lee; Phillips; Poinsett; St. Francis (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 7:44PM CDT until April 15 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: The National Weather Service in Memphis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Lee County in eastern Arkansas... St. Francis County in eastern Arkansas... Southwestern Poinsett County in eastern Arkansas... Northeastern Phillips County in eastern Arkansas... Crittenden County in eastern Arkansas... Cross County in eastern Arkansas... * Until 830 PM CDT. * At 743 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from McFadden to 11 miles northeast of Des Arc to Stuttgart Municipal Airport, moving east at 75 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... West Memphis, Forrest City, Marion, Wynne, Marianna, Earle, Hughes, Parkin, Madison, Palestine, Village Creek State Park, St Francis National Park, Cherry Valley, Caldwell, Crawfordsville, Edmondson, Colt, Wheatley, Horseshoe Lake and Lexa. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Memphis.

area.areaDesc: Crittenden; Cross; Lee; Phillips; Poinsett; St. Francis
